website_summaries.verdict: The Sony Cyber-shot DSC-WX150 is an excellent little camera that doesn't sacrifice features and performance for size.
pros: The Sony Cyber-shot DSC-WX150 is a very fast, 10x zoom ultracompact with lots of automatic shooting options, and very good photo and video quality
cons: The WX150's 18-megapixel resolution is of little use and its small, lightweight body can make it difficult to keep the zoom lens steady

customer_reviews.title: Astonishing images from a tiny gem.
customer_reviews.text: If you can still grab one of these, do it. As a camera nut who uses a dslr primarily, I am super impressed with images produced by this tiny gem. When I don’t want to carry anything bigger than a phone but want a capable camera, I reach for this one. The menus can be a little confusing, and this is not the most robust small camera, but if you take time to learn it and take care of it, you will get images far better than what a phone can produce.
customer_reviews.author: J. Richter

customer_reviews.title: After 5 years still great
customer_reviews.text: In the beginning I used this a lot until I got dependent on my smartphone for most of my photo taking needs. However, the features of this camera are outstanding. the various modes take memorable and stylistic photos that are unique. The Background Defocus mode hardly ever works, but when it does...WOW I can't complain about the quality of the video recorder, but I also can't rave about it. It's ok Overall this is a solid affordable point ans shoot camera.
customer_reviews.author: jay

customer_reviews.title: Don't kid yourself. No phone will ever match a decent camera
customer_reviews.text: As you can guess, this is light years ahead of phone cameras. Nothing beats optics when it comes to picture quality. I do love the camera in my iPhone 7, but it cannot zoom and had far fewer settings. This camera is a great P&S that will fit into almost any pocket. I take it hiking all the time when I don't want to be bothered with my Sony Alpha gear. It's good enough for photo quality shots without the bulk. Don't kid yourself. No phone will ever match a decent camera.
customer_reviews.author: Lt. Frank Bullitt

customer_reviews.title: A good upgrade
customer_reviews.text: I dropped and broke the predecessor to this camera, a Sony DSC-W530. I wanted an upgrade but did not want or need a whole lot of bells and whistles. After reading reviews of the DSC-WX150 and several other brands recommended by my cousin, a professional photographer I picked this camera. I photograph dogs in my grooming salon with some additional pictures of cats and a rabbit at home, which I post on Facebook and my website. Not only are the pictures clear but there is almost no lag time when I click, which was the case with the W530. This baby also takes great shots in low-light circumstances. Great value for money!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Rector

customer_reviews.title: Great Pictures.  Easy To Use.
customer_reviews.text: This camera takes great pictures. We got it because my Canon Powershot was too difficult for my wife to take impromptu pictures with. This was the perfect camera for her. It has many preset settings, but she keeps it on one setting all the time. The shots are nearly as good or as good as the shots from the Powershot with me selecting just the right settings. It is small. It has a great zoom. And, it is easy to use. The first charge lasted about month with moderate use. Update: The optical zoom on this camera does indeed work during movie recording.
customer_reviews.author: C. Festavan

customer_reviews.title: good but not rugged
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for work, I work mostly outdoors in sometimes harsh, hot/humid environments. This took great photos at first but after 6 months the battery door latch wouldn't hold so I had to use tape to keep it closed. It also did not operate well in humid conditions; when you turned it on the lens would stick and it wouldn't turn on correctly. After a year the picture quality deteriorated due to it wasn't focusing properly so I got another camera. It's an okay camera if you baby it, but if you plan on using it in action settings it may not last as long as you want.
customer_reviews.author: Dino_G

customer_reviews.title: I don't love it.
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a Canon Elph because it was taking a very long time between pictures. However, it had a viewfinder as well as the screen. I could not find a small camera to replace it that had both. When it is very bright outside you cannot tell what you are taking a picture of - you just hope for the best. In addition, this camera seems to have a problem with the on/off switch. Sometimes the camera starts quickly, sometimes slowly and sometimes not at all. I sent it back to Sony in Texas and they supposedly fixed it but it still has the same problem. Pictures are generally okay. Next camera will be another Canon.
customer_reviews.author: Retired and Happy

customer_reviews.title: Sony WX-150
customer_reviews.text: Very nice truly pocketable digicam. Very, very fast on focusing, shutter lag, between shot time and writing to memory card. Image quality is very good for a 1/2.33 sensor. Very little noise in good light and nice punchy colors. Lots of filters, effects and post-picture processing. Major drawback is maximum aperture of only 3.3, but for its size factor (tiny!) and having a ten X zoom, that's to be expected. Lens is top of the line Sony G and extremely sharp. This was the king of the hill until the Sony RX100 came out with its 1" sensor, but it's twice the price.
customer_reviews.author: Terry R. Hall

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for the money
customer_reviews.text: I was very pleasantly surprised by this camera. It couldn't be easier to use and it really does take some great quality pictures in most light. I am not completely enamored with its low light picture quality but it is by no means BAD, just not as great as the pictures it takes in good lighting, but really, I didn't expect amazing performance from it based its price. The screen is bright and clear and makes setting up your pictures and framing everything properly extremely easy. Overall, if you are looking for a good camera, especially for the money and arent looking for professional level picture quality, this is a great buy!
customer_reviews.author: JRS200x

customer_reviews.title: Nice Everyday Camera, Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product refurbished. The quality is good. The only glitch with this re-furbished model is that many times when I try to turn it on it does not respond - the power light is on but the lens does not open. This requires some finagling and has caused me to miss a few shots. Overall, I am very satisfied with this product because it takes nice pictures and is easy to use. I bought it to replace a Sony DSC-W350 and it is better than that model, in my opinion clearer photos, better zoom. I am a casual photographer - mostly snapshots to document family life.
customer_reviews.author: B. Meredith

customer_reviews.title: VERY NICE
customer_reviews.text: I have owned several small Sony point-and-shoot cameras. W80, W150, WX1, WX10, and now the WX150. The WX150 is the smallest and lightest of them all. I am very pleased with the image quality given the small sensor and the high pixel count. I was confused when the PMB software could not detect my videos on the SD card, but once I installed the newer software, PlayMemories Home, everything worked just fine. One suggestion for improvement. PlayMemories Home can only detect videos when the camera is connected to the computer, not when the SD card is inserted into a card reader. It would be nice if the latter was possible.
customer_reviews.author: Randy C. Finch

customer_reviews.title: Good little camera
customer_reviews.text: I like this camera. It is light weight and easy to use. The pictures are great - good quality. I researched many models and brands, and this one got the best reviews. My only objection is the noise. I can't figure out how to make it silent. I have turned the noise volume down as far as it goes, but it still makes noise when I turn the camera on. This is a problem if I am in a place where I want quiet - like a wedding, a lecture or a group when a guide is talking. Other than that, I have nothing bad to say about this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine. Heathcliff

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera, battery didn't last long
customer_reviews.text: Bought the camera in January and the battery died last week. Wouldn't work at all and I was afraid that it was the camera. Took it to Batteries plus and they tested the battery-dead (I had tried charging it on the wall and with the computer with no luck prior to this.) A new battery and we're back in business. I love it, but hope the battery isn't an issue anymore. At least I have a year warrantee on the new battery! Update 10/22/2013 New battery died as well so tried to charge battery with a charging unit. Charging unit says the battery is fully charged. Sounds like a camera issue now. Not very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Fosalyer

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Great camera - resolution is awesome and it is compact and easy to take with me anywhere. I use this camera more than my more expensive Nikon.
customer_reviews.author: dr liberty

customer_reviews.title: WX-150 User Friendly-Great Photos
customer_reviews.text: An amazing little camera. 18 mp and the zoom works well keeping the picture clean and clear. The controls are so easy to learn and use. I have seen a lot of camera's over the years...and this is a keeper. The editing tools are fantastic and fun and produce some unique and beautiful photos at any size. It is great to carry around which is why I bought it in the first place. I was tired of toting around my bulky cameras and gear. I have two nice DSL's (Nikon D40 and 5000) and I use this camera more LoL really!!
customer_reviews.author: JoLM

customer_reviews.title: Nice little camera
customer_reviews.text: I was happy with this purchase, although I agree with what other users have stated. It is a bit challenging to learn to use the camera, which didn't pose as much a problem for me since I only needed a few basic functions and learned them quickly enough to serve my purposes. I am not a fan of the way the functions are made available. Too hard to get to one from another, but the camera does take really nice photos, is light and compact. It contains some great functions if you want to take the time to learn how to manage them and have patience when using.
customer_reviews.author: Shawneeisme

customer_reviews.title: The Best Camera for an amateur wannabe photographer :-)
customer_reviews.text: I always loved taking pictures but this camera encourages me to take it to another level with all the awesome effects it offers. I bought this as a Christmas gift to myself and no other gidt compared. The room could be lit with a candle & the picture will come out looking like you had all the lights on. The clarity is unbelievable! Even on shots taken a distance away. Its very lite in weight & small. The only thing missing is a Photoshop type function but that's on my wish list not a defect. If you enjoy taking pictures this camera is for you.
customer_reviews.author: NeetNix

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: This camera takes great pictures! Im just a mom taking picture of my kids so it works great for what I need it for. The pictures are crisp and sharp, the hd video recording is awesome and its so convenient to have it right in the camera. It has a lot of shooting options and I have yet to use a lot of them. I have taken some scenery pictures and theyve all been gorgeous as well. Im very happy with this camera. Its powerful and small, exactly what I needed to snap pictures of my kids.
customer_reviews.author: krny1

customer_reviews.title: Recommend
customer_reviews.text: I got some great pictures from my trip with this camera and had a lot of people comment on the quality of my pictures. The only downside...and this may be more of a user error thing...is that action shots are hard to take...but keep in mind that I'm still figuring out the camera. I am also not a fan of the "night feature" which always gave me pictures with light streaks running through them. Other than that I am really pleased with my purchase and would recommend this camera. Happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: SometimesBuyer

customer_reviews.title: it's good for me
customer_reviews.text: I'm an amateur with camera mechanical details (shutter speed, F-stop, ISO exposure, etc.) but can still speak for the end results. I've had this for about 3 months now and I like what I see. Wow, what a noticeable improvement over my previous 5 year old point-and-shoot digital. While I haven't gone deep into the menu for custom settings, I have experimented with various conditions: strong back light, low light, etc in the fully automatic setting most all to my pleasure. It really leaves the composition of the shot my prime concern and takes care of the rest. That's just what I wanted. So, at well under $200, It was recommended to me and I now recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: Reno_local

customer_reviews.title: Easy as Pie
customer_reviews.text: I am a camera novice and this was so easy to use. I bought it a few days before my trip to Costa Rica and just hoped for the best. I was able to take the most amazing pictures of the sea, wildlife and people-the zoom in feature was great. The camera itself was so simple to use and the anti-shake feature really worked as did the light adjustment and auto flash features. Another big plus is how compact the camera is, easily fits in a pocket. I ordered my prints through Shutterfly and they were gorgeous. The price for this is really a steal!
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Moore

customer_reviews.title: Happy with this camera
customer_reviews.text: The camera works well with still photos and very well with movies. I am especially happy with the short lag time between pushing the the shutter button and the actual picture taking. I keep it on the "Easy" setting and I haven't experimented with the advanced options; I did try the panarama setting and was very happy with the results. I cannot comment on any of the advanced settings but I would definitely recommend this camera for the average family use. No down side so far.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent, but not great camera with mediocore macro for a point and shoot.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my fiance to catalog the places we go and the flowers and wildlife we encounter. I looked at reviews and saw good things about the macro mode, something necessary for decent flower photos. We have not had the same experience even after fiddling with the settings and trying many different techniques. It takes decent photos, but I was taking much higher quality pictures with a Lumix in the same price range I was using for work. The menus are convoluted as well.
customer_reviews.author: B-Rad

customer_reviews.title: Sony Cyber Shot
customer_reviews.text: I needed a new camera. After months of comparing, I settled on the Sony cyber Shot. I owned one before and it was a very good camera. I love the easy mode for ones like me who are not professionals, but want to take quality pictures. I like the style and am happy with my purchase. I would wait for a holiday sale closer than what I paid. The day after I got what I thought was a good deal, the next day it was $20 cheaper and added a memory card. Sony web site also had some better prices. I bought mine from Amazon and still think it is the best place to buy online.
customer_reviews.author: SINDIE

customer_reviews.title: Quite frankly and simply stated "it's the best digital camera that I have ever owned"
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this November 28, 2012 and am just now writing my first review after 2 years of using it. Quite frankly and simply stated "it's the best digital camera that I have ever owned". It's what I have come to expect from the Sony brand name over the years and I have "not" been disappointed. No problems whatsoever with it even after 2 years of usage.
customer_reviews.author: Hank

customer_reviews.title: Fast, accurate focus even up close
customer_reviews.text: I like the camera in general. Picture quality is good, video is good enough. What I love about the camera is how well it focuses up close. Coming from an older Canon compact this thing can capture anything. Only grips is with some of the on-board picture post-processing. For example, there is a "background out of focus" mode that simply blurs whatever is not in focus. This works well sometimes but you can often tell that it's an analog depth of field effect.
customer_reviews.author: Artur Grabowski

customer_reviews.title: great camera
customer_reviews.text: i always struggle to find a small camera which does let enough light in to make decent pictures in the dark. Of course, the size of the lens ultimately limits it. its not a SLR. I also, have bigger SLRs but am too lazy to take it with me. Since i have this little one here i leave my SLR at home because it does an awesome job. Outside at good light you wouldn't see a difference to my SLR. Inside with not enough illumination the camera is limited but it does its job. i went through quite some little pocket cameras but was never happy. this one i keep
customer_reviews.author: Peter Dietz

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad point &shoot
customer_reviews.text: Not much to add to the positive reviews. I always carry something like this in my satchel. Fits the bill perfectly - small, cheap, decent pictures, nice zoom. I docked it one star because a lot of my pictures taken utilizing the zoom were not sharp - too much internal noise removal. Not trying to compare it to a dslr or anything, but compared to my Canons (SX40 & S95) the images are a less sharp. I would recommend it to anyone looking for an inexpensive always have one around camera.
customer_reviews.author: BuckWheat

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: Tiny but with lots of functions. Easy to use. Like the panoramic shooting mode. The button on the right top of the camera change the shooting mode from regular to panoramic to video easily. Loaded with anti-shaking mode, and background blurry mode (kinda gives SLR fort of feeling when shooting close objects). Cons: shutter speed a little slow. Panoramic shooting is hard to control and always ended with a partial image (i.e. a little portion to the right of the picture is black), which is probably due to the sweeping speed.
customer_reviews.author: Sinbad

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love that this camera can fit in my pocket so I can have it ready to shoot a picture whenever I see something that I like. The photo is really clear. After a little testing, I was able to figure out how to find the best setting. It took a couple of times to download the software to my computer. It is made special for those with a Playstation and since I do not have a Playstation I had to figure out how to download just what is needed for my computer. I recommend this camera.
customer_reviews.author: E.D.Z.

customer_reviews.title: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-WX150
customer_reviews.text: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-WX150 sadly disappointed in this camera. Has a long recovery time between pictures.......... was expecting a very quick turn around when I read the description video software has to be download, then only works with windows. That was not in the description..... not like the Sony's used to be..... Save your money, was not worth the savings deal I found and try something else I wish I had ....
customer_reviews.author: David Hanson

customer_reviews.title: great ultra with 10x zoom
customer_reviews.text: This camera seems to have it all, bought a second one for a relative. I have had cameras in the past that every time I went to use it I went back to the manual, but the interface on this model is relatively simple. The only downside is the skimpy manual, I found it easier to read some reviews and reference the on-line manual. We have taken a few hundred pics so far and they are great. Fits in your shirt pocket, easy to use, great features, great zoom and great pics.
customer_reviews.author: lunker

customer_reviews.title: An affordable, functional camera that will do what you need and more
customer_reviews.text: After an ex decided to help himself to a significantly more expensive camera I owned in the process of a breakup, I replaced it with this puppy. It's affordable, does the job, does not require reading instructions if you are at all tech savvy, and all of my pictures and videos turn out better than expected. Love it. Great for travel. I've had it 2 years now and it still holds up. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: bee girl

customer_reviews.title: Great Pics and easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: This camera was a gift for my daughter and she loves it. It is easy to use and she loves all the features including digitial video and panaramic pictures. It has great zoom. We did a lot of comparison shopping before deciding on the Sony Cyber-shot DSC-WX150 and based on her reaction and the quality of the pictures she has taken so far, we definitely made the right choice. She also loves the size - it is small enough to put in her purse or pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Golden Jewel

customer_reviews.title: Takes nice pictures
customer_reviews.text: I got this camera to replace my 8 yr old Fuji point and shoot. I like the compact design and the various picture settings. I am able to take very nice pictures even in low light. My only complaint so far is that even on the anti-blur settings, I still get blurry shots if there's a lot of motion, which isn't ideal when you have a small child. However, I'm still learning how to use this camera (it's very different from my old camera), so it could be user error.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Good little camera
customer_reviews.text: I love the zoom on this camera and for a point and shoot...... this little thing takes crisp pictures but I just wish that someone could make a camera that is as faster between shots. I don't mean the burst mode but high speed shot after shot. I love this for what it is, a great little camera that I have just in case I don't have my DSLR handy but I miss some great moments. Overall this is as good a point and shoot for the money you can find!
customer_reviews.author: peter1007

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT MIX OF POWER AND SIMPLICITY
customer_reviews.text: This camera does it all, and you don't need a photography degree to operate it. You can set it to take 10 shots in rapid succession, or you can set it to take pictures that look like illustrations. You can press one button to start recording video immediately. It is great because it is simple and versatile. Also, the battery lasts plenty long. I strongly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: W. Moore

customer_reviews.title: real easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This camera is perfect for my wife who is not tech savvy. Set it on auto everything and let the camera do the work. No need to look for the right settings, it does it all for you. I am sure there are better cameras out there for those that have it as a serious hobby. But for us, it is a point and shoot. The panorama feature is real easy and super cool to use. The camera is smaller than most, but after handling it for a while, you forget and it is easy to throw in your pocket or purse. So far... we love this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Radio44

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: After using this for about a year, I am not impressed. The shutter is very slow. The picture quality depends on the exact setting which when achieved doesn't work if you step out the room or if the light changes. You have to fiddle around with the settings taking a pic each time to choose the correct one. And honestly, ain't nobody got time for that.
customer_reviews.author: AV

customer_reviews.title: Quite fragile
customer_reviews.text: Fairly quickly, the rotating wheel for making settings changes became quite touchy. If I tried to make a change, it would flicker between multiple options even when I wasn't touching the wheel Often it would take a couple of minutes to make a simple change. Unfortunately I dropped my wx150 a short ways. Even though it was protected inside a hard shell case, it now can only create fuzzy pictures.
customer_reviews.author: YouReview

customer_reviews.title: Good performance but
customer_reviews.text: The picture quality and speed are very good. It has a decent set of extra features. The 10x optical zoom on a camera this small is impressive. However, it doesn't seem as well built as other cameras in this price range. The top of the camera has some flex to it and the battery door doesn't close very snugly when the battery is in the camera. Also the zoom lens has more flex to it than expected. I doubt this camera would survive more than a few drops.
customer_reviews.author: J. Walker

customer_reviews.title: Great features but stopped working
customer_reviews.text: The USB port stopped charging the battery after only a week. I don't use the USB but have an AC charger with spare batteries so no big deal but be warned. UPDATE 6-18-2013: The camera now won't turn on and appears to have a problem with the lens motor failing with error flashing C32:60 and turns off by itself. Only lasted 1 month.
customer_reviews.author: LR Evans

customer_reviews.title: Sony Cyber Shot WX150 18.2 MP
customer_reviews.text: Wow, what a wonderful camera. with lots of options with it for a small camera. I usually shoot with a larger Professional 35 mm digital camera and wanted something smaller but still powerful with lots of options when your out and about and want something smaller, and this camera does just that ! Thanks Sony.... Great Camera !! 01/23/2013 Jonoknee
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I love the results of the video this camera does. Excellent quality in it's sound recording. I also love the zoom quality. Its got an easy to read in the camera user guide which is very helpful to find what all this camera can do. I am loving it. Great for someone who wants to just point and shoot, no muss, no fuss- and get great quality photos. So far every time I transfer the pics to my PC and see the photos enlarged, I just keep saying Wow, Wow, Wow, that's how good it is.
customer_reviews.author: Me Now

customer_reviews.title: Nice little Camera
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and good quality shots. The video zoom is smooth and always in focus. The HD is striking watching on a tv. I downloaded to my PS3, and like to watch videos and slide-shows. Many nice features like the shoot a still shot when in video mode, the panoramic feature, 3D capable, the nice long zoom. Small enough to fit in your pocket and have with so you don't miss a shot, is partly why I bought this camera. It responds quickly, and ready for the next shot. Looked at many cameras and found this to be a good value. It is my first Sony camera, and I am impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A very expensive disposable camera
customer_reviews.text: After just over a year of use, getting error E:62:10, which Sony will only fix if I give them $91. On top of that, when I take a picture and then immediately look at it, it is rotated 90 degrees. I've Initialized the camera, formatted the memory card, tried tapping the battery side, and every other solution I can find online and nothing works. This camera has been a huge disappointment. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: ne_pats_fan_27

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera
customer_reviews.text: Got this camera to replace my old Canon Powershot SD450. It takes great pictures. A friend took it to Puerto Rico and came back with pictures you'd expect to see on a DSLR. Impressed with the capabilities of such a little camera. I haven't gotten to use it too much yet since I just got it recently and my main camera is a Canon Rebel. But for days when I don't want to lug around my big camera, I'm looking forward to using this one.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Great camera!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using my very old 10 MP Cannon digital camera, and this was a great replacement. Picture quality was much much better. 10x optical zoom is very nice and awesome for the size of this camera. Its got so much features. I love the pano and the 10x frame shoot per second feature is nice to have. I would recommend this camera to my friends. I bought this on Black Friday 2012 for a very very good deal.
customer_reviews.author: sam.i.am

customer_reviews.title: fix-up photo feature
customer_reviews.text: This camera has an amazing "Superior Auto" setting. with a yellow i-camera-plus icon, to "shoot sharp image reducing blue and noise automatically." I took a photo, saw it on the display, then in 2-3 seconds, the display changed to the awesome version of the photo. Otherwise, this camera is a little smaller and thicker than a cell phone, fits nicely in the pocket, and takes great photos and high-def video.
customer_reviews.author: Reader

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect little camera. It takes great shots and it fits into your purse. I used it just a few nights ago at my nephew's chorus event and was able to shoot video and the 10X zoom was very helpful. I am still discoverying the extra features and will be taking this on our family vacation this August and hope to get some great candids at my brother's wedding in August.
customer_reviews.author: LoriLynn

customer_reviews.title: Great Pictures
customer_reviews.text: First, you should understand that I suck at taking pictures. Honestly, I think every picture I've ever taken has been off center and out of focus. Not so with this camera! I've had a great time playing with all the extra features, though I doubt I'll ever use them in every day camera use. I wanted to be able to point and shoot great pictures, and that's exactly what I got.
customer_reviews.author: MellyE

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: i bought this for my wife about a year ago. It has been great. It does drain the battery fairly quickly so I bought an extra batt. This take great pictures. We took it to Yellowstone and was amazed when we got back at how well it did. We have some fantastic shots of all sorts of animals and landscapes.
customer_reviews.author: MMT-Red

customer_reviews.title: Met my expectations for a small camera
customer_reviews.text: I had a trip to Europe planned and at the last minute, I decided it might be nice to have a small camera to stuff in a pocket. I had the older version of the Sony Cybershot, but it was bulky and didn't fit well into my back pocket. So I expressed order this version of the CyberShot. I took hundreds of pictures and not always in the most ideal conditions (rain, cold, umbrella, crowds, etc), and it worked great. The battery life was great though I did tend to turn it off after the photo op. My only complaint is I had to take my glove off to turn the camera on:-).
customer_reviews.author: javaphin

customer_reviews.title: Just the Thing
customer_reviews.text: Did my research and concluded that this would be best replacement for old, broken camera. Wanted a point-and-shoot that just took good pictures and was easy to use. This fits the bill exactly. It looks like it has many features and adjustments to improve the picture quality, but I'm not oriented in that direction, so I just use it as it is and I'm fine with it.
customer_reviews.author: pportion

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Camera
customer_reviews.text: The little camera is great... Pic's are wonderful on the auto settings and if you want to change things up there are many manual setting to take pic's your way. I've had this Sony for a month now and it's the best little camera in it's class, fast shutter, clear pic's. Uses SD cards which are very easy to find and cheap. You won't be sorry purchasing one of these.
customer_reviews.author: blueskysthunder

product_meta.title: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-WX150 18.2 MP Exmor R CMOS Digital Camera with 10x Optical Zoom and 3.0-inch LCD (Black) (2012 Model)
product_meta.description:
Color:BlackFocus faster day or night with this slim Sony Cyber-shot DSC-WX150 digital camera. High speed AF dramatically improves speed and accuracy, while 10X optical and 20X Clear Image zoom gets you close enough to capture every ounce of the action. Boasting an 18.2-megapixel Exmor R CMOS sensor, exceptional low-light performance is yours while shooting high-resolution photos or Full HD 1080/60i videos (records in 29-minute segments). And with the ability to shoot up to 10 frames per second (fps), you'll be sure to capture the fleeting moments that other cameras miss.What's in the box: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-WX150 Digital Camera (Black), NP-BN Battery, ACUB10 AC Adapter, Micro USB Cable, Wrist Strap, Instruction Manual and 1-Year Limited Warranty.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
 A+ 





Focus faster, day or night, with the slim Sony® DSC-WX150. Its sensitive 18.2MP
sensor and wide-angle, ultra-stabilized 10X Optical/20X Clear Image zoom
capture stunning images as well as AVCHD™ 1080/60i videos. 18.2MP Exmor® R CMOS sensor High Speed Auto Focus Optical zoom plus Clear image zoom The 18.2MP Exmor® R CMOS sensor enables advanced processing that reduces noise levels more than other sensors, resulting in stunning low light images with incredible details. To improve focusing speed and sensitivity, the Exmor® R sensor uses its rapid throughput to deliver high-quality image signals to the camera’s BIONZ® processor. The result is fast, DSLR-like focusing speeds, even in low light. Clear image digital zoom maintains a high-resolution feel that is as precise as optical zoom and vastly expands the zoom range without lowering visible quality or pixel count in the final image. 
Technology Pixel Power With an 18.2MP Exmor R CMOS sensor, capture high-resolution images that take full advantage of the camera's sharp Sony G lens. More pixels means you can enlarge, zoom in and crop your photos without losing detail. Advanced processing reduces noise and graininess for incredibly crisp, clear images—even in low-light conditions. Focus Faster Focusing is faster than ever thanks to the collaboration of four technologies: an advanced Sony G lens, Exmor R CMOS sensor, a newly-developed BIONZ® image processor and optimized focus processing. The result? Tack-sharp focus in as little as 0.1 seconds, so you never miss a shot. 20x Clear Image Zoom Zoom in close for great sports, wildlife and travel photos. The WX150 combines 10x optical zoom with Clear Image digital zoom technology to offer 20x total zoom. Powerful By Pixel Super Resolution processing technology reduces graininess for crisper, more realistic, higher-quality images—even in close-ups. Amazing HD Movies Record crystal-clear movies at the highest resolution available with Full HD 1080/60i AVCHD™ video capture.1 Stunning, fast-motion video with reduced distortion looks great when played on your HDTV.2 Notice a perfect photo opp while shooting video? With dual record of stills and movies, you can shoot both at the same time. Never Miss a Moment Capture up to 10 frames per second at full 18.2MP resolution. The perfect feature for high-speed sports or capturing a unique sequence of photos, no matter how fast the action, you know you'll get the shot. Plus, a mechanical shutter helps reduce distortion when continuously shooting moving subjects for even crisper, clearer high-speed shots. Say Goodbye to Blur Don't let a not-so-steady hand prevent you from capturing the moment. Optical SteadyShot™ image stabilization with Active Mode compensates for camera shake by countering camera movements in both horizontal and vertical directions. Get sharp, blur-free footage in otherwise unsteady situations, like shooting video while walking. 
Product description and full feature list Explore the full range of features and options below. 
18.2MP Exmor® R CMOS sensor
The 18.2MP Exmor® R CMOS sensor captures ultra-high definition images that take full advantage of the camera's sharp Sony® G lens.The sensor enables advanced processing that reduces noise levels more than other sensors, resulting in stunning low light images with incredible details. 

High speed AF
To improve focusing speed and sensitivity, the Exmor® R CMOS sensor uses its rapid 240fps throughput to deliver high-quality image signals to the camera's BIONZ® processor. The result is fast, DSLR-like focusing speeds, even in low light. 

Optical zoom plus Clear image zoom
Clear image digital zoom maintains a high-resolution feel that is as precise as optical zoom and vastly expands the zoom range without lowering visible quality or pixel count in the final image. With By Pixel Super Resolution processing, the camera's 10x optical zoom range is extended, allowing full resolution 18.2MP images with a maximum 20x zoom. 

Full HD 1080/60i
Record crystal clear movies at the highest resolution available with capabilities for 60i in 1080 AVCHD™ video.1 This provides stunning, fast motion video with less distortion for playback on your HD TV.2 With dual record of stills and movies, you can shoot both at the same time.

Capture the decisive
moment - up to 10fps
Capture full 18.2 megapixel resolution images at up to 10 frames per second, helping to ensure that the decisive moment is captured such as the soccer ball flying into the goal. In addition, a mechanical shutter helps reduce distortion when continuously shooting moving subjects. 

Optical SteadyShot™
with Active Mode
Optical SteadyShot™ with Active Mode for
blur-free movies even while walking. Camera-shake compensation using Optical SteadyShot/Active Mode has been improved with the addition of new electronic image stabilization. Now it's easier than ever to obtain sharp, blur-free movies even when zooming in unsteady situations, such as shooting with one hand
while walking. 


3D still image and
3D Sweep Panorama™ mode3
Produce awe-inspiring images with 3D still image and 3D Sweep Panorama™ capabilities.3 Photos will take on a new dimension of creative capabilities for viewing the world in a whole new way. 

Picture Effect
Picture Effect adds a new level of expression to photos, making ordinary landscapes and portraits come to life by heightening mood and emphasizing certain attributes. Select camera models have up to nine different effects. 

Intelligent Sweep
Panorama™ HR mode
With Intelligent Sweep Panorama™ HR mode just press the shutter, pan the landscape and
let the camera do the rest. It automatically links together each frame to produce a high resolution panoramic image providing the ability to zoom in on small details. This model even detects faces and moving subjects to stitch intelligently different widths to help avoid subject distortion.

Background Defocus
DSLR photographs are often beautiful because they blur the background, putting the emphasis on the subject. Now our point-and-shoot cameras can deliver this signature DSLR benefit. The system takes two shots, identifies the background and applies a defocused background keeping the subject crisp and clear. 

Superior Auto mode
Get cleaner, more dynamic pictures and fewer missed shots. The camera automatically recognizes the correct scene mode, then quickly shoots and combines up to six shots to produce images with greater clarity, optimum dynamic range using Backlight Correction HDR technology and lower image noise using 6 shots layering technology. Superior Auto intelligently detects 33 scenes for still images and movies, making it easy to get the best shot.

Photo Creativity 
Photo Creativity Photo Creativity allows you to fine-tune your exposure settings, such as brightness, color, and vividness, and quickly choose the right enhancement for your subject. Now you can view Picture Effects and Photo Creativity effects in real time on the camera’s monitor or in the viewfinder before shooting. 

Face Detection technology
Face Detection technology detects up to eight individual faces and adjusts focus, exposure, and white balance to help deliver crisp, properly lit images of family and friends.



Smile Shutter™ technology
Smile Shutter™ technology captures a smile the moment it happens. Simply press the Smile Shutter™ button and the camera does the rest. You can also select adult and child priority and indicate the degree of Smile Detection sensitivity. Intelligent Scene Recognition can be used together with Smile Shutter™ mode when the Intelligent Auto mode is on. This means that beautiful smiles can be captured with settings optimized for the particular scene, even in difficult conditions such as twilight and backlighting.

Natural Flash
Conventional point-and-shoot camera flash shots just don't capture colors the way the eye sees them. Natural Flash controls the white balance of both the background and main subjects. 

Motion Detection
Motion Detection, along with Face Motion Detection adjusts ISO sensitivity and increases the shutter speed when movement is detected, reducing blur in moving subjects and faces.

Anti-blink Function
It's frustrating to capture the perfect shot, only to review it later and discover subjects blinked during the photo. The Anti-blink function works to help counter blinking and squinting. When the camera is set to Soft Snap, the Anti-blink function captures two images, recording only the photo with less squinting. If a blink is detected in other shooting modes, a warning will be displayed after you take the shot. 

Soft Skin mode
Portrait subjects will love the results. Soft Skin mode recognizes skin tones and reduces the appearance of blemishes and wrinkles without affecting the rest of the shot. 

Intelligent Scene Recognition mode
Intelligent Scene Recognition (iSCN) Mode automatically detects 33 different types of scenes and selects the appropriate camera settings. iSCN has two modes: Auto and Advanced. In Auto Mode, the camera takes a single shot using the optimal settings. In Advanced Mode, the camera takes a photo with the optimal settings and, if in difficult lighting (low light or back light) immediately takes a second photo. 

Sweep Multi Angle™ mode
In Sweep Multi Angle™ mode, the camera takes 15 images at different angles as it sweeps across the scene. By tilting the camera during playback, the camera's Gyro Sensor detects motion and displays the image in a 3D-like view on the camera's LCD.
